revised_title: Interannual Oscillations in an Ocean General Circulation Model Coupled to a Simple Atmosphere Model: A Review
tldr: This article presents a study on interannual oscillations in an ocean general circulation model coupled with a simple atmosphere model. The authors develop an intermediate coupled model to understand the oscillation mechanism in coupled general circulation models without atmospheric noise. They find that the coupled system undergoes a Hopf bifurcation, resulting in three to four-year oscillations, and a secondary bifurcation for six-month oscillations during the warm phase of the El Niño period. The study suggests that atmospheric noise is not essential for the oscillations.
